Class Player

java.lang.Object
Player
public class Player extends Object
Player.java is participates in a game through a GameMaster.
The Player is responsible for the Cards in his/her hand.

  • Constructor Details

    • Player

      public Player(String n)
      The constructor initializes the instance fields. The Player's name is supplied in the parameter. The token counter is initialized to 0. The array of Card objects is instantiated. The indicator for having a full hand of cards is initialized to false.
      Parameters:
      n - the Player's name

  • Method Details

    • drawCard

      public void drawCard(Card c)
      The drawCard() method enables the Player to add a Card to his/her hand, as long as there is space in the array.
      A Player can have a maximum of five Cards.
      The first Card that the Player receives is automatically the active card. Hence, the first position (index 0) is the active position.
      The drawn Card is placed in the next available space.
      If the Player is drawing his/her fifth Card, the indicator for having a full hand is changed to true.

      Note: This method is called on a Player object by the GameMaster. It is only called when the Player's hand is not full.
      Parameters:
      c - the Card to be added to the Player's hand

    • discard

      public void discard()
      The discard() method enables the Player to remove the Card that has been eliminated from his/her hand.
      The Player vacates the active position.
      In the event that there is no card to promote, the position is set to null.
      Upon discarding, the Player's hand is no longer full.

      Note: This method is called on a Player object by the GameMaster. It is only called when a Card in the Player's hand is eliminated.

    • swap

      public String swap()
      The swap() method enables the Player to swap two cards.
      The active card will be swapped with another card in the Player's hand with the highest "determining product", i.e., current health multiplied by attack-power.
      The Player must determine if there is more than one card in hand.
      If the Player has at least two cards, the swap() method invokes the private method, findCard(), to locate the card to be activated.

      The javadoc for findCard() is shown below.
         The findCard() method is a private method that is called only by the swap() method.
         This method goes through the other (inactive) Cards in the Player's hand and locates the card with the highest "determining product."
         The "determining product" is computed by multiplying a Card's health with its attack-power.
         If the Card is found, the method returns the array index corresponding to the Card's location.
         If the Card is not found, the method returns -1.
         If the Card is found, the method returns the array index corresponding to the location of the Card to be activated.

      When the card is found, the two cards swap places.
      When the swap is done, the Player reports the completion in the format: 
       NewActiveCardName is now active with NewActiveCardHealth health.
      In the event that the Player only has one card left, and therefore has no other card to swap with, the Player reports the error in the format: 
       PlayerName has no other card to swap with. Turn forfeited.
      Note: This method is called on a Player object by the GameMaster. It is only called when the play to be made is a swap.
      Returns:
      the complete message to be displayed as output

    • claimToken

      public void claimToken()
      The claimToken() method enables the Player to increment (add 1) to the number of prizes accumulated.
      Note: This method is called on a Player object by the GameMaster. It is only called when the Player eliminates an opponent's Card.

    • getActiveCard

      public Card getActiveCard()
      The getActiveCard() method enables the Player to return the Card object in the first (active) position.

      Note: This method is called on a Player object by the GameMaster.
      Returns:
      the Player's active Card

    • getName

      public String getName()
      The getName() method enables the Player to return his/her name.

      Note: This method is called on a Player object by the GameMaster.
      Returns:
      the Player's name

    • getTokens

      public int getTokens()
      The getTokens() method enables the Player to indicate how many tokens he/she has accumulated.

      Note: This method is called on a Player object by the GameMaster to determine a winner.
      Returns:
      total number of tokens the Player has accumulated

    • handIsFull

      public boolean handIsFull()
      The handIsFull() method enables the Player to indicate whether or not his/her hand is full.

      Note: This method is called on a Player object by the GameMaster when dealing Cards.
      Returns:
      true if the Player's hand is full, false otherwise

    • statusReport

      public String statusReport()
      The statusReport() method enables the Player to display the status of the Cards in his/her hand.
      The Player only lists the Cards that are still in his/her hand, with a maximum of five cards.
      The report is displayed in the format (excluding square brackets): 
       [PLAYERNAME]
         [Card1Name] : [Card1HitPoints]
         [Card2Name] : [Card2HitPoints]
         [Card3Name] : [Card3HitPoints]
         [Card4Name] : [Card4HitPoints]
         [Card5Name] : [Card5HitPoints]
      Returns:
      the complete message to be displayed as output
